pli-tv-pvr2.10:0.4.eng: The number of offenses within each offense

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.0.eng: 1. The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of consenting to physical contact?

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.2.eng: One commits five kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.3.pli: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ gahaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.3.eng: when a lustful nun consents to a lustful man taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.4.pli: bhikkhu kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.4.eng: when a monk makes physical contact, body with body, he commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.5.eng: when, with one’s own body, one makes physical contact with something connected to their body, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.6.eng: when, with something connected to one’s own body, one makes physical contact with something connected to their body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.7.eng: for tickling, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:1.8.pli: kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā imā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of concealing an offense?

pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.2.eng: One commits four kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.3.pli: Bhikkhunī jānaṃ pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ paṭicchādeti, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.3.eng: when a nun knowingly conceals an offense entailing expulsion, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.4.eng: when, being unsure, she conceals it, she commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.4.comm: This ruling does not seem to be found in the Canonical text, either for monks or nuns.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.5.eng: when a monk conceals an offense entailing suspension, he commits an offense entailing confession;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:2.6.eng: when one conceals a failure in conduct, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.1.pli: Yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.1.eng: “How many kinds of offenses does one commit as a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time?”

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.2.pli: Yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.2.eng: One commits five kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.3.pli: Ukkhittānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati, ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.3.eng: when a nun takes sides with one who has been ejected and does not stop when pressed for the third time, then after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.4.eng: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.5.eng: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.6.pli: bhedakānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.6.eng: when a nun sides with a monk who is pursuing schism and she does not stop when pressed for the third time, she commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.7.pli: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa—
pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.7.eng: when not giving up a bad view after being pressed for the third time, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:3.8.pli: yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā imā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.1.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ vatthuṃ paripūraṇapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does she commit as a result of fulfilling the eight parts?

pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.2.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ vatthuṃ paripūraṇapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.2.eng: She commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.3.pli: Purisena—“itthannāmaṃ okāsaṃ āgacchā”ti vuttā gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.3.eng: when she goes to such-and-such a place when told by a man to do so, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.4.eng: when she enters within arm’s reach of the man, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.5.eng: when she fulfills the eight parts, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.6.pli: aṭṭhamaṃ vatthuṃ paripūraṇapaccayā imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:4.7.eng: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:5.0.eng: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension, etc.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:5.1.pli: Ussayavādikā bhikkhunī aḍḍaṃ karaṇapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:5.1.eng: As a result of initiating a lawsuit, a litigious nun commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:5.2.eng: when she tells one other person, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:5.3.eng: when she tells a second person, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:5.4.eng: when the lawsuit is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:6.1.eng: As a result of giving the full admission to a female criminal, she commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:6.2.eng: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:6.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:6.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:7.1.pli: Ekā gāmantaraṃ gamanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:7.1.eng: As a result of walking to the next inhabited area by herself, she commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:7.2.eng: when she is in the process of going, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:7.3.pli: paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ parikkhepaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:7.3.eng: when she crosses the boundary with her first foot, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:7.4.eng: when she crosses with her second foot, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:8.1.pli: Samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṃ bhikkhuniṃ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṃ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṃ osāraṇapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:8.1.eng: As a result of readmitting—without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the community—a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, she commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:8.2.eng: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:8.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:8.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:9.1.pli: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:9.1.eng: As a result of eating fresh or cooked food after receiving it directly from a lustful man, a lustful nun commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:9.2.eng: when she receives fresh or cooked food with the intention of eating it, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:9.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, she commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:9.4.eng: if she receives water or a tooth cleaner, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:10.1.pli: “Kiṃ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṃ anavassutā. Iṅgha, ayye, yaṃ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā taṃ tvaṃ sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti, uyyojanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:10.1.eng: As a result of urging a nun on, saying, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, if you’re without? Go on, venerable, receive it with your own hands and then eat whatever fresh or cooked food he gives you,” she commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:10.2.pli: Tassā vacanena khādissāmi bhuñjissāmīti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.10:10.2.eng: when, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:10.3.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:10.4.eng: when the meal is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:11.1.pli: Kupitā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:11.1.eng: As a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time, an angry nun commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:11.2.eng: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:11.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:11.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:12.1.pli: Kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:12.1.eng: As a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time, a nun who has lost a legal case commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:12.2.eng: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:12.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:12.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:13.1.pli: Saṃsaṭṭhā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:13.1.eng: As a result of not stopping when pressed for the third time, a socializing nun commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:13.2.eng: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:13.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:13.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:14.1.pli: “Saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha, mā tumhe nānā viharitthā”ti uyyojentī yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:14.1.eng: As a result of urging the nuns on, saying, “Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately,” and not stopping when pressed for the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:14.2.eng: after the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:14.3.eng: after each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:14.4.eng: when the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:15.1.eng: The ten rules entailing suspension are finished. …

pli-tv-pvr2.10:16.1.eng: (To be expanded as above, (pli-tv-pvr2.2:17.0) to (pli-tv-pvr2.2:141.3), with the only difference being the addition of “as a result of”.)

pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.1.eng: How many kinds of offenses does she commit as a result of asking for curd and then eating it?

pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.2.eng: She commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.3.eng: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.4.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.5.pli: dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā imā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.10:17.6.eng: The number of offenses within each offense, the second, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.11:0.4.eng: The classes of failure for each offense

pli-tv-pvr2.11:1.1.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.11:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of consenting to physical contact, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.11:1.2.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.11:1.2.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.11:1.3.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr2.11:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.11:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of asking for curd and then eating it, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.11:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.11:2.2.eng: They belong to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.11:3.1.eng: The classes of failure for each offense, the third, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.12:0.4.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense

pli-tv-pvr2.12:1.1.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr2.12:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of consenting to physical contact, in how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.12:1.2.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ pañcahi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr2.12:1.3.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā saṅghādisesāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.12:1.3.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-pvr2.12:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katihi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā?
pli-tv-pvr2.12:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of asking for curd and then eating it, in how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.12:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ dvīhi āpattikkhandhehi saṅgahitā—

pli-tv-pvr2.12:2.3.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing acknowledgment; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.12:3.1.eng: The classes of offenses in each offense, the fourth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.13:1.1.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.13:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of consenting to physical contact, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.13:1.2.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ ekena samuṭṭhānena samuṭṭhanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.13:1.3.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.13:1.3.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of asking for curd and then eating it, through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ catūhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.3.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhanti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.3.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.4.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhanti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.4.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.5.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.5.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr2.13:2.6.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti.

pli-tv-pvr2.13:3.1.eng: The originations of each offense, the fifth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.14:0.4.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs

pli-tv-pvr2.14:1.1.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr2.14:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of consenting to physical contact, to which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.14:1.2.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.14:1.2.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense. …

pli-tv-pvr2.14:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr2.14:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of asking for curd and then eating it, to which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.14:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ—āpattādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-pvr2.14:2.2.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr2.14:3.1.eng: The legal issues to which each offense belongs, the sixth, are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.15:1.1.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.15:1.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of consenting to physical contact, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.15:1.2.pli: Kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.15:1.3.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.15:1.3.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr2.15:2.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.15:2.1.eng: When it comes to the offenses that are a result of asking for curd and then eating it, through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.15:2.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā āpattiyo sattannaṃ samathānaṃ tīhi samathehi sammanti—

pli-tv-pvr2.15:2.3.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr2.15:2.3.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr2.15:3.1.eng: How each offense is settled, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:0.4.eng: Summary of the previous six sections

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.1.eng: As a result of consenting to physical contact, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.2.eng: One commits five kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.3.pli: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa adhakkhakaṃ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ gahaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.3.eng: when a lustful nun consents to a lustful man taking hold of her anywhere below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.4.pli: bhikkhu kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.4.eng: when a monk makes physical contact, body with body, he commits an offense entailing suspension;

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.5.eng: when, with one’s own body, one makes physical contact with something connected to their body, one commits a serious offense;

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.6.eng: when, with something connected to one’s own body, one makes physical contact with something connected to their body, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.7.eng: for tickling, one commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:1.8.pli: kāyasaṃsaggaṃ sādiyanapaccayā imā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.2.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.3.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.4.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.5.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.6.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ dve vipattiyo bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.6.eng: They belong to two kinds of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.7.eng: they may be failure in morality; they may be failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.8.eng: They are found in five classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.9.pli: siyā pārājikāpattikkhandhena, siyā saṅghādisesāpattikkhandhena, siyā thullaccayāpattikkhandhena, siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandhena, siyā dukkaṭāpattikkhandhena.
pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.9.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion; they may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension; they may be in the class of serious offenses; they may be in the class of offenses entailing confession; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.11.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.11.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.12.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.13.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.14.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr2.16:2.14.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr2.16:3.1.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
pli-tv-pvr2.16:3.1.eng: As a result of asking for curd and then eating it, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:3.2.pli: Dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
pli-tv-pvr2.16:3.2.eng: She commits two kinds of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:3.3.eng: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

pli-tv-pvr2.16:3.4.eng: for every mouthful swallowed, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:3.5.pli: dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā imā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.1.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ kati vipattiyo bhajanti?
pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.1.eng: When it comes to these offenses, to how many of the four kinds of failure do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.2.eng: In how many of the seven classes of offenses are they found?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.3.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses do they originate?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.4.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues do they belong?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.5.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues are they settled?

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.6.pli: Tā āpattiyo catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ ekaṃ vipattiṃ bhajanti—
pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.6.eng: They belong to one kind of failure:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.8.eng: They are found in two classes of offenses:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.9.eng: they may be in the class of offenses entailing acknowledgment; they may be in the class of offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.11.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhanti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.11.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhanti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.12.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.13.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.13.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.14.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhanti.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.15.eng: They belong to legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.16.eng: They are settled through three principles:

pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.17.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena cāti.
pli-tv-pvr2.16:4.17.eng: they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or they may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:5.1.eng: The summary of the previous six sections, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:5.2.eng: The eight sections on “as a result of” are finished.

pli-tv-pvr2.16:6.1.eng: The sixteen great sections of the Nuns’ Analysis are finished.
